intro: Agrostemma inflatum, commonly known as the inflated grass pink, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces showy, inflated, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its common name. Agrostemma inflatum is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in well-drained soils.
